template.name: NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP
template.description:
The template to monitor SAN NetApp AFF A700 cluster by Zabbix HTTP agent.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: Cluster location
item.description: The location of the cluster.

item.name: Cluster name
item.description: The name of the cluster.

item.name: Cluster IOPS, other rate
item.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item.name: Cluster IOPS, read rate
item.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster IOPS, total rate
item.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster IOPS, write rate
item.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster IOPS raw, other
item.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item.name: Cluster IOPS raw, read
item.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster IOPS raw, total
item.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster IOPS raw, write
item.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster latency, other
item.description: The average latency per I/O operation in milliseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item.name: Cluster latency, read
item.description: The average latency per I/O operation in milliseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster latency, total
item.description: The average latency per I/O operation in milliseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster latency, write
item.description: The average latency per I/O operation in milliseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster latency raw, other
item.description: The raw latency in microseconds observed at the storage object. This can be divided by the raw IOPS value to calculate the average latency per I/O operation. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item.name: Cluster latency raw, read
item.description: The raw latency in microseconds observed at the storage object. This can be divided by the raw IOPS value to calculate the average latency per I/O operation. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster latency raw, total
item.description: The raw latency in microseconds observed at the storage object. This can be divided by the raw IOPS value to calculate the average latency per I/O operation. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster latency raw, write
item.description: The raw latency in microseconds observed at the storage object. This can be divided by the raw IOPS value to calculate the average latency per I/O operation. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster throughput, other rate
item.description: Throughput bytes observed at the storage object. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item.name: Cluster throughput, read rate
item.description: Throughput bytes observed at the storage object. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster throughput, total rate
item.description: Throughput bytes observed at the storage object. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster throughput, write rate
item.description: Throughput bytes observed at the storage object. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item.name: Cluster status
item.description: The status of the cluster: ok, error, partial_no_data, partial_no_response, partial_other_error, negative_delta, backfilled_data, inconsistent_delta_time, inconsistent_old_data.

trigger.name: Cluster status is abnormal
trigger.description: Any errors associated with the sample. For example, if the aggregation of data over multiple nodes fails then any of the partial errors might be returned, “ok” on success, or “error” on any internal uncategorized failure. Whenever a sample collection is missed but done at a later time, it is back filled to the previous 15 second timestamp and tagged with "backfilled_data". “Inconsistent_ delta_time” is encountered when the time between two collections is not the same for all nodes. Therefore, the aggregated value might be over or under inflated. “Negative_delta” is returned when an expected monotonically increasing value has decreased in value. “Inconsistent_old_data” is returned when one or more nodes do not have the latest data.

item.name: Cluster software version
item.description: This returns the cluster version information. When the cluster has more than one node, the cluster version is equivalent to the lowest of generation, major, and minor versions on all nodes.

trigger.expression: last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.cluster.version,#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.cluster.version,#2) and length(last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.cluster.version))>0
trigger.name: Version has changed
trigger.description: __RESOURCE__ version has changed. Ack to close.

item_prototype.name: {#ID}: State
item_prototype.description: The chassis state: ok, error.

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.state[{#ID}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.state[{#ID}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.state[{#ID}])="error")
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.state[{#ID}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.state[{#ID}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.state[{#ID}])="ok")
trigger_prototype.name: {#ID}: Chassis has something errors
trigger_prototype.description: Something is wrong with the chassis.

item_prototype.name: {#DISKNAME}: State
item_prototype.description: The state of the disk. Possible values: broken, copy, maintenance, partner, pending, present, reconstructing, removed, spare, unfail, zeroing

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.disk.state[{#NODENAME},{#DISKNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.disk.state[{#NODENAME},{#DISKNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.disk.state[{#NODENAME},{#DISKNAME}])<>"present")
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.disk.state[{#NODENAME},{#DISKNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.disk.state[{#NODENAME},{#DISKNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.disk.state[{#NODENAME},{#DISKNAME}])="present")
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKNAME}: Disk of the Node "{#NODENAME}" has state different from "present"
trigger_prototype.description: Something is wrong with the disk.

item_prototype.name: {#FRUID}: State
item_prototype.description: The FRU state: ok, error.

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.fru.state[{#CHASSISID},{#FRUID}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.fru.state[{#CHASSISID},{#FRUID}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.fru.state[{#CHASSISID},{#FRUID}])="error")
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.fru.state[{#CHASSISID},{#FRUID}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.fru.state[{#CHASSISID},{#FRUID}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.chassis.fru.state[{#CHASSISID},{#FRUID}])="ok")
trigger_prototype.name: {#FRUID}: FRU of the chassis "{#ID}" state is error
trigger_prototype.description: Something is wrong with the FRU.

item_prototype.name: {#LUNNAME}: Space size
item_prototype.description: The total provisioned size of the LUN.

item_prototype.name: {#LUNNAME}: Space used
item_prototype.description: The amount of space consumed by the main data stream of the LUN.

item_prototype.name: {#LUNNAME}: Container state
item_prototype.description: The state of the volume and aggregate that contain the LUN: online, aggregate_offline, volume_offline. LUNs are only available when their containers are available.

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.container_state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.container_state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.container_state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}])<>"online")
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.container_state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.container_state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.container_state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}])="online")
trigger_prototype.name: {#LUNNAME}: LUN of the SVM "{#SVMNAME}" has abnormal container state
trigger_prototype.description: LUNs are only available when their containers are available.

item_prototype.name: {#LUNNAME}: State
item_prototype.description: The state of the LUN. Normal states for a LUN are online and offline. Other states indicate errors. Possible values: foreign_lun_error, nvfail, offline, online, space_error.

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}])<>"online")
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.lun.status.state[{#SVMNAME},{#LUNNAME}])="online")
trigger_prototype.name: {#LUNNAME}: LUN of the SVM "{#SVMNAME}" has abnormal state
trigger_prototype.description: Normal states for a LUN are online and offline. Other states indicate errors.

item_prototype.name: {#NODENAME}: Software version
item_prototype.description: This returns the cluster version information. When the cluster has more than one node, the cluster version is equivalent to the lowest of generation, major, and minor versions on all nodes.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.node.version[{#NODENAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.node.version[{#NODENAME}],#2) and length(last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.node.version[{#NODENAME}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#NODENAME}: Version has changed
trigger_prototype.description: {#NODENAME} version has changed. Ack to close.

item_prototype.name: {#NODENAME}: Controller over temperature
item_prototype.description: Specifies whether the hardware is currently operating outside of its recommended temperature range. The hardware shuts down if the temperature exceeds critical thresholds. Possible values: over, normal

trigger_prototype.name: {#NODENAME}: Node has over temperature
trigger_prototype.description: The hardware shuts down if the temperature exceeds critical thresholds(item's value is "over").

item_prototype.name: {#NODENAME}: Location
item_prototype.description: The location of the node.

item_prototype.name: {#NODENAME}: Membership
item_prototype.description: Possible values: available - If a node is available, this means it is detected on the internal cluster network and can be added to the cluster. Nodes that have a membership of “available” are not returned when a GET request is called when the cluster exists. A query on the “membership” property for available must be provided to scan for nodes on the cluster network. Nodes that have a membership of “available” are returned automatically before a cluster is created. joining - Joining nodes are in the process of being added to the cluster. The node may be progressing through the steps to become a member or might have failed. The job to add the node or create the cluster provides details on the current progress of the node. member - Nodes that are members have successfully joined the cluster.

item_prototype.name: {#NODENAME}: State
item_prototype.description: State of the node: up - Node is up and operational. booting - Node is booting up. down - Node has stopped or is dumping core. taken_over - Node has been taken over by its HA partner and is not yet waiting for giveback. waiting_for_giveback - Node has been taken over by its HA partner and is waiting for the HA partner to giveback disks. degraded - Node has one or more critical services offline. unknown - Node or its HA partner cannot be contacted and there is no information on the node's state.

trigger_prototype.name: {#NODENAME}: Node state is abnormal
trigger_prototype.description: The state of the node is different from up: booting - Node is booting up. down - Node has stopped or is dumping core. taken_over - Node has been taken over by its HA partner and is not yet waiting for giveback. waiting_for_giveback - Node has been taken over by its HA partner and is waiting for the HA partner to giveback disks. degraded - Node has one or more critical services offline. unknown - Node or its HA partner cannot be contacted and there is no information on the node's state.

item_prototype.name: {#NODENAME}: Uptime
item_prototype.description: The total time, in seconds, that the node has been up.

item_prototype.name: {#ETHPORTNAME}: State
item_prototype.description: The operational state of the port. Possible values: up, down.

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.eth.state[{#NODENAME},{#ETHPORTNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.eth.state[{#NODENAME},{#ETHPORTNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.eth.state[{#NODENAME},{#ETHPORTNAME}])="down")
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.eth.state[{#NODENAME},{#ETHPORTNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.eth.state[{#NODENAME},{#ETHPORTNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.eth.state[{#NODENAME},{#ETHPORTNAME}])="up")
trigger_prototype.name: {#ETHPORTNAME}: Ethernet port of the Node "{#NODENAME}" is down
trigger_prototype.description: Something is wrong with the ethernet port.

item_prototype.name: {#FCPORTNAME}: Description
item_prototype.description: A description of the FC port.

item_prototype.name: {#FCPORTNAME}: State
item_prototype.description: The operational state of the FC port. Possible values: startup - The port is booting up. link_not_connected - The port has finished initialization, but a link with the fabric is not established. online - The port is initialized and a link with the fabric has been established. link_disconnected - The link was present at one point on this port but is currently not established. offlined_by_user - The port is administratively disabled. offlined_by_system - The port is set to offline by the system. This happens when the port encounters too many errors. node_offline - The state information for the port cannot be retrieved. The node is offline or inaccessible.

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.fc.state[{#NODENAME},{#FCPORTNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.fc.state[{#NODENAME},{#FCPORTNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.fc.state[{#NODENAME},{#FCPORTNAME}])<>"online")
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.fc.state[{#NODENAME},{#FCPORTNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.fc.state[{#NODENAME},{#FCPORTNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.port.fc.state[{#NODENAME},{#FCPORTNAME}])="online")
trigger_prototype.name: {#FCPORTNAME}: FC port of the Node "{#NODENAME}" has state different from "online"
trigger_prototype.description: Something is wrong with the FC port.

item_prototype.name: {#SVMNAME}: Comment
item_prototype.description: The comment for the SVM.

item_prototype.name: {#SVMNAME}: State
item_prototype.description: SVM state: starting, running, stopping, stopped, deleting.

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.svm.state[{#SVMNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.svm.state[{#SVMNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.svm.state[{#SVMNAME}])<>"running")
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.svm.state[{#SVMNAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.svm.state[{#SVMNAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.svm.state[{#SVMNAME}])="running")
trigger_prototype.name: {#SVMNAME}: SVM state is abnormal
trigger_prototype.description: Something is wrong with the SVM.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Comment
item_prototype.description: A comment for the volume.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Available size
item_prototype.description: The available space, in bytes.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Space size
item_prototype.description: Total provisioned size. The default size is equal to the minimum size of 20MB, in bytes.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Used size
item_prototype.description: The virtual space used (includes volume reserves) before storage efficiency, in bytes.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: State
item_prototype.description: Volume state. A volume can only be brought online if it is offline. Taking a volume offline removes its junction path. The 'mixed' state applies to FlexGroup volumes only and cannot be specified as a target state. An 'error' state implies that the volume is not in a state to serve data.

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.volume.state[{#VOLUMENAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.volume.state[{#VOLUMENAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.volume.state[{#VOLUMENAME}])<>"online")
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.volume.state[{#VOLUMENAME}],#1)<>last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.volume.state[{#VOLUMENAME}],#2) and last(/NetApp AFF A700 by HTTP/netapp.volume.state[{#VOLUMENAME}])="online")
trigger_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume state is abnormal
trigger_prototype.description: A volume can only be brought online if it is offline. Taking a volume offline removes its junction path. The 'mixed' state applies to FlexGroup volumes only and cannot be specified as a target state. An 'error' state implies that the volume is not in a state to serve data.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume IOPS, other rate
item_prototype.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume IOPS, read rate
item_prototype.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume IOPS, total rate
item_prototype.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume IOPS, write rate
item_prototype.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume IOPS raw, other
item_prototype.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume IOPS raw, read
item_prototype.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume IOPS raw, total
item_prototype.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume IOPS raw, write
item_prototype.description: The number of I/O operations observed at the storage object. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume latency, other
item_prototype.description: The average latency per I/O operation in milliseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume latency, read
item_prototype.description: The average latency per I/O operation in milliseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume latency, total
item_prototype.description: The average latency per I/O operation in milliseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume latency, write
item_prototype.description: The average latency per I/O operation in milliseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume latency raw, other
item_prototype.description: The raw latency in microseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume latency raw, read
item_prototype.description: The raw latency in microseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume latency raw, total
item_prototype.description: The raw latency in microseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume latency raw, write
item_prototype.description: The raw latency in microseconds observed at the storage object. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume throughput, other rate
item_prototype.description: Throughput bytes observed at the storage object. Performance metric for other I/O operations. Other I/O operations can be metadata operations, such as directory lookups and so on.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume throughput, read rate
item_prototype.description: Throughput bytes observed at the storage object. Performance metric for read I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume throughput, total rate
item_prototype.description: Throughput bytes observed at the storage object. Performance metric aggregated over all types of I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume throughput, write rate
item_prototype.description: Throughput bytes observed at the storage object. Performance metric for write I/O operations.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: SVM name
item_prototype.description: The volume belongs this SVM.

item_prototype.name: {#VOLUMENAME}: Type
item_prototype.description: Type of the volume. rw - read-write volume. dp - data-protection volume. ls - load-sharing dp volume.

macro.description: The HTTP agent timeout to wait for a response from AFF700.
